net.floodlightcontroller.core

Interface IOFSwitch

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IOFMessageWriter
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IOFSwitchBackend
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MockOFSwitchImpl, OFMessageDamperMockSwitch, OFSwitch

    public interface IOFSwitch
extends IOFMessageWriter
    An openflow switch connecting to the controller. This interface offers methods for interacting with switches using OpenFlow, and retrieving information about the switches.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IOFSwitch.SwitchStatus

      • getTables

        java.util.Collection<TableId> getTables()
        Get the specific TableIds according to the ofp_table_features. Not all switches have sequential TableIds, so this will give the specific TableIds used by the switch.
        Returns:

      • getSwitchDescription

        SwitchDescription getSwitchDescription()
        Returns:
        a copy of the description statistics for this switch

      • getInetAddress

        java.net.SocketAddress getInetAddress()
        Get the IP address of the remote (switch) end of the connection
        Returns:
        the inet address

      • getEnabledPorts

        java.util.Collection<OFPortDesc> getEnabledPorts()
        Get list of all enabled ports. This will typically be different from the list of ports in the OFFeaturesReply, since that one is a static snapshot of the ports at the time the switch connected to the controller whereas this port list also reflects the port status messages that have been received.
        Returns:
        Unmodifiable list of ports not backed by the underlying collection

      • getEnabledPortNumbers

        java.util.Collection<OFPort> getEnabledPortNumbers()
        Get list of the port numbers of all enabled ports. This will typically be different from the list of ports in the OFFeaturesReply, since that one is a static snapshot of the ports at the time the switch connected to the controller whereas this port list also reflects the port status messages that have been received.
        Returns:
        Unmodifiable list of ports not backed by the underlying collection

      • getPort

        OFPortDesc getPort(OFPort portNumber)
        Retrieve the port object by the port number. The port object is the one that reflects the port status updates that have been received, not the one from the features reply.
        Parameters:
        portNumber -
        Returns:
        port object

      • getPort

        OFPortDesc getPort(java.lang.String portName)
        Retrieve the port object by the port name. The port object is the one that reflects the port status updates that have been received, not the one from the features reply. Port names are case insentive
        Parameters:
        portName -
        Returns:
        port object

      • getPorts

        java.util.Collection<OFPortDesc> getPorts()
        Get list of all ports. This will typically be different from the list of ports in the OFFeaturesReply, since that one is a static snapshot of the ports at the time the switch connected to the controller whereas this port list also reflects the port status messages that have been received.
        Returns:
        Unmodifiable list of ports

      • getSortedPorts

        java.util.Collection<OFPortDesc> getSortedPorts()
        This is mainly for the benefit of the DB code which currently has the requirement that list elements be sorted by key. Hopefully soon the DB will handle the sorting automatically or not require it at all, in which case we could get rid of this method.
        Returns:

      • portEnabled

        boolean portEnabled(OFPort portNumber)
        Parameters:
        portNumber -
        Returns:
        Whether a port is enabled per latest port status message (not configured down nor link down nor in spanning tree blocking state)

      • write

        boolean write(OFMessage m,
            LogicalOFMessageCategory category)
        Writes a message to the connection specified by the logical OFMessage category
        Parameters:
        m - an OF Message
        category - the category of the OF Message to be sent
        Returns:
        true upon success; false upon failure

      • write

        java.lang.Iterable<OFMessage> write(java.lang.Iterable<OFMessage> msglist,
                                  LogicalOFMessageCategory category)
        Writes a message list to the connection specified by the logical OFMessage category
        Parameters:
        msglist - an OF Message list
        category - the category of the OF Message list to be sent
        Returns:
        list of failed messages, if any; success denoted by empty list

      • getConnectionByCategory

        Get a connection specified by the logical OFMessage category
        Parameters:
        category - the category for the connection the user desires
        Returns:
        an OF Connection

      • writeStatsRequest

        <REPLY extends OFStatsReply>  writeStatsRequest( request,
                                                   LogicalOFMessageCategory category)
        write a Stats (Multipart-) request, register for all corresponding reply messages. Returns a Future object that can be used to retrieve the List of asynchronous OFStatsReply messages when it is available.
        Parameters:
        request - stats request
        category - the category for the connection that this request should be written to
        Returns:
        Future object wrapping OFStatsReply If the connection is not currently connected, will return a Future that immediately fails with a @link{SwitchDisconnectedException}.

      • writeRequest

        <R extends OFMessage>  writeRequest( request,
                                       LogicalOFMessageCategory category)
        write an OpenFlow Request message, register for a single corresponding reply message or error message.
        Parameters:
        request -
        categiry - the category for the connection that this request should be written to
        Returns:
        a Future object that can be used to retrieve the asynchrounous response when available. If the connection is not currently connected, will return a Future that immediately fails with a @link{SwitchDisconnectedException}.

      • getTableFeatures

        TableFeatures getTableFeatures(TableId table)
        Get the features of a particular switch table. The features are cached from the initial handshake, or, if applicable, from a more recent OFTableFeaturesStatsRequest/Reply sent by a user module.
        Parameters:
        table, - The table of which to get features.
        Returns:
        The table features or null if no features are known for the table requested.

      • getNumTables

        short getNumTables()
        Get the number of tables as returned by the ofp_features_reply.
        Returns:

      • getLatency

        U64 getLatency()
        Get the one-way latency from the switch to the controller.
        Returns:
        milliseconds
